newsitem.title: USA: Alpha 1 seeks financing to continue opers.
newsitem.headline: Alpha 1 seeks financing to continue opers.

text.p: Alpha 1 Biomedicals Inc said Thursday it continues to seek additional financing to fund operations beyond the second quarter of 1997.
Alpha 1 said in a release that based on existing resources, it will have sufficient cash to sustain operations to the middle of the second quarter of 1997.
However, the company said that, if additional financing cannot be obtained prior to that time, it will likely be forced to discontinue operations.

The company reported revenues for the first quarter of $9,229 and a net loss of $210,844, or $0.02 per share. The results for the same quarter of the preceding year were revenues of $8,288 and a loss of $1,069,763, or $0.12 per share.
Alpha 1 said that research and development expenses during the current period were $39,336, a decrease of $748,192 from the prior period.
It said the current period decrease reflects the effect of a cost reduction program implemented during early 1996.

General and administrative expenses during the current period were $145,925, the company said, a decrease of $84,994 from the comparable period a year earlier. It added that the decrease primarily reflects the effect of the cost reduction program and the effect of proprietary rights becoming fully amortized during the prior period.
Alpha 1 said that during 1996, it suspended its development program for Thymosin beta 4, the company's proprietary product, primarily due to a lack of funding.

During March 1997, the company said it concluded a $200,000 private placement of equity securities, the proceeds of which will be used for general and administrative expenses, in addition to conducting preclinical animal studies using Thymosin beta 4.
Subsequent to March 31, 1997, Alpha 1 said it received an additional $50,000 from the private placement, but that it continues to seek additional financing to fund operations.
